column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////I was on a mission to try the best pizza joints in Chicago. I was only going to be there for three days so I had to be meticulous with my selections and...Lou Malnati's was the winner! (Pequod's and Gino's were the other two I tried) The buttery crust was outstanding especially because it was crispy on the edges. The tomato sauce was exquisite
column2: every element of this pizza blew me away. This was exactly the experience I wanted before I left Chicago. Sure
column3: it might be touristy but its family owned and the service was wonderful. It's so good
column4: don't miss out on giving it a try. FYI I cry sometimes because Lou Malnati's isn't in LA
